Wyoming.WOOD (AM):
WOOD is a news/talk radio station broadcasting at 1300 kHz and 106.9 MHz in Michigan, United States. WOOD-AM is licensed to Grand Rapids, Michigan and WOOD-FM to Muskegon, Michigan.


== History ==


=== Full-service station ===
WOOD-1300 is the oldest radio station in West Michigan and one of the oldest in the world, having signed on September 16, 1924 as WEBK as a marketing tool for the C.J. Litscher Company, a seller of radio receivers.
